definition: to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale
variant of 呼[hu1]/to shout/to call out

sentences.english: They whooped a welcome at the gate when the group of delegations came in.
sentences.chinese: 代表团进入的时候他们在大门口高呼欢迎。

sentences.english: On Friday, many had shouted that "The people want the regime to fall."
sentences.chinese: 上周五，不少人高呼“人民政权要下降。”

sentences.english: "Get down, get down, " the anti-Mubarak crowd chanted at him.
sentences.chinese: “趴下，趴下，”反穆巴拉克人群中高呼他。

sentences.english: They chanted slogans against the government and against President Bashar al-Assad.
sentences.chinese: 他们高呼反政府和反对总统阿萨德的口号。

sentences.english: Looking at the victorious enemy, I am relieved, put down the bottle, and then turn around and.
sentences.chinese: 望着高呼胜利的敌军，我释然，放下酒樽，然后转身。

sentences.english: Mourners chanted slogans calling for the removal of the government.
sentences.chinese: 哀悼者高呼口号政府呼吁撤走。

sentences.english: At this time, David took a group of fans, chanting support is simple.
sentences.chinese: 此时，戴维领着一班戏迷，高呼支持简洁。

sentences.english: The demonstrators chanted and waved flags and pictures of the president.
sentences.chinese: 示威者高呼口号，并挥舞着旗帜和阿萨德总统的照片。

sentences.english: Denisov shouted angrily, and he walked away from the barrier.
sentences.chinese: 杰尼索夫恼怒地高呼，之后他就走开了。

sentences.english: Mousavi shouted slogans in Tehran Sunday as one person read Mr.
sentences.chinese: 穆萨维的支持者周日在德黑兰高呼口号。

sentences.english: People yelled "the murderer should be put to the hell" and put Sadam's portrait to the fire.
sentences.chinese: 人们高呼“杀人犯该死”并焚烧萨达姆的画像。

sentences.english: When the flag was raised this morning they gathered on the piazza and took off their hats and gave three cheers.
sentences.chinese: 今晨升旗，大家聚在空地上，脱帽致敬，高呼三声。

sentences.english: Participants shout slogans during a May Day protest in Seoul May 1, 2007.
sentences.chinese: 南韩首尔五一劳工节高呼口号的抗议者。

sentences.english: People hurrahed to de Gaulle for 20 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 人们向戴高乐高呼万岁达20多分钟。

definition: to shout loudly/to raise a cry/to yell
Long live (the king, the revolution etc)!/Your Majesty/His Majesty
to sing loudly/fig. to mouth slogans
to yell/to shout/to call out for (a person)
